name: Boiler CTF - TryHackMe Room
description: MITRE ATT&CK Navigator layer mapping for the Boiler CTF challenge. Shows attack techniques across reconnaissance, web exploitation, credential access, lateral movement, and privilege escalation phases.

techniques.comment: Gather Victim Host Information - Enumeration of web services and host details
Gather Victim Host Information: Software - Enumerated SSH version (OpenSSH 7.2p2) and Joomla/sar2html versions

metadata.name: Discovery Method
metadata.value: Service version scanning and web directory enumeration

techniques.comment: Gather Victim Host Information: Client Configurations - Discovered web application structure (/joomla/_test directory)

metadata.name: Discovery Method
metadata.value: HTTP directory enumeration and web browsing

metadata.name: Key Finding
metadata.value: Found .tar file with sar2html version information

techniques.comment: Active Scanning - Port and service scanning for vulnerability identification
Active Scanning: Scanning IP Blocks - Full port enumeration using Nmap

metadata.name: Result
metadata.value: Identified 7 open/filtered ports including SSH on non-standard port 55007

techniques.comment: Active Scanning: Vulnerability Scanning - Service version detection and fingerprinting
Active Scanning: Web Application Scanning - Enumerated HTTP directories and discovered vulnerable web applications

metadata.name: Discovery Method
metadata.value: HTTP GET requests and directory enumeration

techniques.comment: Exploit Public-Facing Application - sar2html 3.2.1 RCE vulnerability exploitation

metadata.name: Vulnerability
metadata.value: Remote Code Execution via improper input validation in 'plot' parameter

metadata.name: Impact
metadata.value: Critical - Unauthenticated RCE as web application user

metadata.name: Exploit Method
metadata.value: Python script executing arbitrary commands through web interface

techniques.comment: Unsecured Credentials - Discovery of exposed credentials in multiple locations
Unsecured Credentials: Credentials in Files - Hardcoded credentials in shell scripts and exposed in log files

metadata.name: Primary Discovery
metadata.value: Credentials for 'basterd' user found in sar2html log files via RCE

metadata.name: Vector
metadata.value: Application logs accessible through RCE; hardcoded creds in shell scripts

metadata.name: Impact
metadata.value: Enabled lateral movement between user accounts

techniques.comment: Remote Service Session Initiation - SSH lateral movement between compromised accounts
Remote Service Session Initiation: SSH/Secure Shell - Lateral movement from web application context to user accounts

metadata.name: User Chain
metadata.value: web-app user → basterd user → stoner user (via credential discovery)

techniques.comment: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism - Exploitation of SUID binary for privilege escalation
Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid - Exploited /usr/bin/find SUID binary for root escalation

metadata.name: Result
metadata.value: Root shell obtained with full system access

techniques.comment: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid - Used -p flag to preserve privileges in shell

metadata.name: Defense Evasion Technique
metadata.value: The -p flag in /bin/sh preserves effective user ID despite normal shell reset

metadata.name: Purpose
metadata.value: Maintains root privileges obtained from SUID execution

metadata.name: Effectiveness
metadata.value: Bypasses privilege restrictions normally applied by shells

techniques.comment: Exploit for Privilege Escalation - Remote code execution via vulnerable sar2html application

metadata.name: Execution Context
metadata.value: Commands executed with web server process privileges

metadata.name: Impact
metadata.value: Enabled access to application logs and system information

metadata.name: Attack Chain
metadata.value: Port Scanning → Web Enumeration → sar2html RCE → Log Credential Harvest → SSH Lateral Movement → SUID Exploitation → Root Access

metadata.name: Attack Complexity
metadata.value: Medium - Multi-stage exploitation with credential discovery and escalation
